text.content: In this post, let's discuss some basic concepts of Computer Networks that every Software Engineer from any domain should know.

text.content: A Network is a collection of interconnected entities. A Computer Network is a set of computers sharing resources on network nodes. The computers use a common communication protocol over digital interconnection to communicate with each other. Perhaps the best example of a Computer Network is the present-day

text.content: Network Topologies are how the links and nodes of a network are arranged to communicate with each other. It can be both physical and virtual(Software-defined Networks are virtual topologies)!

rich_text.plain_text: Network Topologies are how the links and nodes of a network are arranged to communicate with each other. It can be both physical and virtual(Software-defined Networks are virtual topologies)!

text.content: Today the most commonly used topologies are -

rich_text.plain_text: Today the most commonly used topologies are -

text.content: In this topology, every network device is connected to a single cable and it transmits data only in one direction.

rich_text.plain_text: In this topology, every network device is connected to a single cable and it transmits data only in one direction.

text.content: In this topology, each computer is connected to another computer in the form of a ring with the last computer connected to the first one.

rich_text.plain_text: In this topology, each computer is connected to another computer in the form of a ring with the last computer connected to the first one.

text.content: In this type of topology, all the nodes are connected to a single network device through a cable.

rich_text.plain_text: In this type of topology, all the nodes are connected to a single network device through a cable.

text.content: Every node is connected to another one with a point-to-point topology and every node is connected.

rich_text.plain_text: Every node is connected to another one with a point-to-point topology and every node is connected.

text.content: It has a root node and all the sub-nodes are connected to the root node in the form of the tree, thereby making a hierarchy. Normally, it has three levels of hierarchy and it can be expanded according to the need of the network.

rich_text.plain_text: It has a root node and all the sub-nodes are connected to the root node in the form of the tree, thereby making a hierarchy. Normally, it has three levels of hierarchy and it can be expanded according to the need of the network.

text.content: Usually, star, bus, or ring topologies are used for networking and the modes used are half-duplex, full-duplex, or simplex.

rich_text.plain_text: Usually, star, bus, or ring topologies are used for networking and the modes used are half-duplex, full-duplex, or simplex.

text.content: Network Engineering is a highly complex task that involves both Software as well as hardware components. To ease the designing, testing, and maintaining process, the whole concept is divided into multiple layers. Each layer has a particular function and is independent of other layers. They depend on each other only to take input and send output.

rich_text.plain_text: Network Engineering is a highly complex task that involves both Software as well as hardware components. To ease the designing, testing, and maintaining process, the whole concept is divided into multiple layers. Each layer has a particular function and is independent of other layers. They depend on each other only to take input and send output.

text.content: The Industry has adopted below two models for Network Engineering. All the hardware and software standards are derived using the below models.

rich_text.plain_text: The Industry has adopted below two models for Network Engineering. All the hardware and software standards are derived using the below models.

text.content: OSI or Open System Interconnect is an open Standard for all communication Systems. It was established by International Standard Organization(ISO). It consists of the below layers -

text.content: The IP address is a logical network address and is a 32-bit number that is globally unique for each network host. It principally consists of two parts i.e. network address & host address.

rich_text.plain_text: The IP address is a logical network address and is a 32-bit number that is globally unique for each network host. It principally consists of two parts i.e. network address & host address.

text.content: Media Access control(MAC) - Defines permissions to transmit and receive. It is a unique device address and each device or component in a network has a MAC address based on which we can uniquely identify a device of the network. It is a 12 digit unique address.

text.content: - It stands for Terminal Emulation Protocol. It is usually used for accessing remote end applications. The telnet server which acts as the host initiates a telnet server application to establish a connection with the remote end host known as the telnet client.

text.content: This layer is responsible for the overall transfer of data. It helps in establishing end-to-end logical connectivity between the server and client host in a network.

text.content: -Â Or Transmission control protocol is a connection-based and reliable protocol. This protocol is the most widely used for exchanging data between servers and clients. TCP used a three-way-handshake to establish a connection between the parties by generating

rich_text.plain_text: -Â Or Transmission control protocol is a connection-based and reliable protocol. This protocol is the most widely used for exchanging data between servers and clients. TCP used a three-way-handshake to establish a connection between the parties by generating

text.content: - Or User datagram protocol is a fairly unreliable connectionless protocol. UDP is used in scenarios where latency matters more than reliability. Hence it is most widely used in gaming, video streaming, etc. In these scenarios, error checking and correction take place at the application layer. Also since it backs the multicast, it is appropriate for broadcast services such as Bluetooth and routing information protocol.

rich_text.plain_text: - Or User datagram protocol is a fairly unreliable connectionless protocol. UDP is used in scenarios where latency matters more than reliability. Hence it is most widely used in gaming, video streaming, etc. In these scenarios, error checking and correction take place at the application layer. Also since it backs the multicast, it is appropriate for broadcast services such as Bluetooth and routing information protocol.

text.content: Ports are used to forward traffic received from the Network to the respective applications running on a host machine. They are what allow a machine to send and receive traffic from several sources at the same time.

rich_text.plain_text: Ports are used to forward traffic received from the Network to the respective applications running on a host machine. They are what allow a machine to send and receive traffic from several sources at the same time.

text.content: IP Addressing is used to recognize the host of a network and uniquely identify a particular device in a network. It works on the Layer-3(Network Layer) of the OSI reference model and the network components like routers and switches are the host devices that are most popularly used.

rich_text.plain_text: IP Addressing is used to recognize the host of a network and uniquely identify a particular device in a network. It works on the Layer-3(Network Layer) of the OSI reference model and the network components like routers and switches are the host devices that are most popularly used.

text.content: An IP Address(IPv4) is a 32-bit logical address that distinctively classifies a host of the network.
